html.action and url.action

13 Feb 2013 development, MVC, gotchas, and web

Some headache last night just before going to bed.

I was trying to output two Uris to data attributes on a html element for navigating to different pages based on the current state of the page. I was getting weird crashes and the debugger kept hitting an action that I wasnâ€™t trying to reach.

Turns out that I was using Html.Action to render the result of invoking an action. This was of course not what I wanted, what I wanted was instead Url.Action, to render a qualified Uri to an action.
